result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwight C Wicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS, with credit for 6 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 15 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Earned Release Program.
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Court imposed 180 days condition time, concurrent with case 15CM001603.  The court ordered the defendant to serve 120 days forthwith.  The remaining 60 days is stayed pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Parenting Classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
  Court willl consider modifying the no contact order only after the defendant completes 1/2 of his batterer's treatment.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Filed (copies provided to defendant),
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Case adjourned for a review hearing in Branch 36.
Probation review hearing scheduled for 02/19/2016 at 01:30 p.m.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to count 1:
  Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - Felonies received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to counts 2 and 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Sentencing adjourned to Branch 36.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Case 15CM1603 recently issued. Defense requesting modification of the No Contact order.  Statements made by the witness. State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Court granted. State's offer will remain open until the Final Pretrial. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to Jury Trial. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Andrew R Rider.  Matthew James Torbenson for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Jason Schulz. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight C Wicks in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Dwight C Wicks in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
